data.pageText:
Trigger attribute allows user to set sequence of actions. Trigger is nothing but an action taken post completion of activity. Trigger value contains three parts separated by space
(action) (target) (condition)
action - possible value [ show/hide ]
target - possible value [id/ class/pageGUID]
condition (optional) - possible value [correct/incorrect]
Example: 
Trigger=”show mcq_1 correct”
Above trigger will unhide activity with id “mcq_1” only if user has completed current activity and score is less than 100%.
Trigger=”show mcq_1 correct”
Above trigger will unhide activity with id “mcq_1” only if user has completed current activity and scored 100%.
Trigger=”show #box”
Above trigger will unhide element with id “box” only if user has completed current activity. 
Trigger=”show cw01~cw01~pg01”
Above trigger will trigger a page jump to page with GUID “cw01~cw01~pg01”

pageTexts.pageText: Q1. Which of the following describes an administrative agency?

option.pageText: A governmental entity with governmental powers
A private company that implements the will of Congress
An organized body of elected officials that works to write and enact new laws
The President of the United States

feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.content:
You have selected correctly.


Yes, an administrative agency is a governmental entity that has governmental powers, generally given to it through statute.

feedback.content:
You have selected incorrectly.


An administrative agency is a governmental entity that has governmental powers, generally given to it through statute.


Private companies are not administrative agencies; administrative agencies are affiliated with the government. An organized body of elected officials that works to write and enact new laws describes a legislative body that creates laws and the President is not an administrative agency, even though the President (like many federal agencies) is part of the executive branch.
